data.title: South Brent Health Centre
data.text:
Female

MBBS, DRCOG, MRCGP with merit

Dr Sarah Galloway qualified from St George’s in 1992. She has worked in general medicine, surgery, orthopaedics, ENT, obstetrics & gynaecology, and mental health. She also worked abroad for a time in Nepal, at a small hospital in the Himalayas. Dr Galloway is interested in women’s health, diabetes, cardiovascular disease, dermatology, and holistic care. Outside of work, she enjoys singing, cold water swimming, and walking in nature.

Male

MBBS, BSc, MCEM, MRCGP, DRCOG

Dr Will Kumar trained in London and moved to Devon in 2004. Before joining General Practice, he worked in a variety of different specialties including Emergency Medicine. Dr Kumar joined South Brent as a partner in 2013. He is a GP registrar trainer and he represents the practice in our Primary Care Network (PCN) meetings. He has a particular interest in men’s health and minor surgery including joint injections. Outside of work he enjoys making the most of all the great opportunities living in Devon provides and sharing them with his young family.

Female

MBChB, BSc, MRCGP

Dr Grace Thompson qualified in 2009 in Bristol. She previously studied Biology and Environmental Science. She trained to be a GP in the Cotswolds. However, she and her family relocated to sunny Devon in 2022, and she was delighted to take up the partnership in South Brent. Dr Thompson is a GP trainer for registrars. She enjoys mental health, lifestyle medicine and holistic care. She works Mondays, Tuesdays, and Thursdays. Outside of work she loves being in nature with her kids as well as campaigning to protect it.

Female

MBBch, DRCOG, MRCGP

Dr Sofka Morris qualified in Cardiff in 2007, and has worked in paediatrics, psychiatry, and obstetrics & gynaecology. Dr Hill was her GP trainer when she worked here as a registrar in 2011. She was delighted to re-join the surgery in 2019 as a GP and has since committed to the GP partnership. Dr Morris is involved with the medical student training and is interested in all areas of general practice. Her usual working days are Mondays and Fridays, with the occasional locum day. Dr Morris lives in Cornwall, enjoying the thrills and spills of family life and the beautiful outdoors

Female

BM, DRCOG, MRCGP, DFSRH

Dr Sarah Bray qualified in 2007 in Southampton. She undertook training in Wales before moving back to Plymouth to do GP training from 2009 to 2012, including 6 months at South Brent Health Centre under Dr Hill. She fell in love with the area and was delighted when the opportunity came up to return to the practice in 2020. Dr Bray works Tuesdays and Thursdays, and is interested in Women's Health and Learning Disabilities. Outside of work, she loves to run and be in the great outdoors - "that's the inner Cornish farmer's daughter in me"

Female

MBChB, MRCGP

Dr Emma Howey qualified in 2015 in Birmingham, and worked in Manchester and Australia before moving home to South Devon to do her GP training in Plymouth, where she did part of her training in South Brent. After a brief period of working in Cornwall, she was very happy to return to South Brent! Dr Howey works Wednesdays and Fridays. Outside of work she loves to be outside, near the beach, and enjoys surfing and tennis in her free time.

Tracy joined us in 2022, after living in New Zealand for 15 years. She previously worked in practices in the Plymouth and Ivybridge area. She is currently undergoing some training updates to allow her to carry out full nursing duties, but she is already available for chronic disease monitoring (including COPD, asthma and diabetes) and some HCA duties.

Practice Manager

Sophie has overall responsibility for the Practice, providing management to guide and develop the team and ensure the sustainability of South Brent Health Centre. She is also responsible for the day to day finances of the Practice. Sophie liaises with the Clinical Commissioning Group, voluntary agencies, other practices and Hospitals to ensure the Practice meets the care requirements of its patients.
